A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her progress, various sorts of turmoil in her D.I.Y life lead to an abortive entry in the race, then a genuine entry, but with an unknown and untested horse. The only thing standing in her way is money — not a lot, but just enough to enter the race.

Although there is melodrama at the center or rather at the bottom of this film, the story is told beautifully and subtly and the acting is superb.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat.
